Tie-dye Tuesdays: Create a weekly event where customers can come in and tie-dye their own ties. This can be a fun and creative way to differentiate your store from others and provide a unique experience for customers.

Tie-in with local artisans: Partner with local artisans to create one-of-a-kind ties that showcase the unique culture and craftsmanship of the area. This can help to establish your store as a hub for local artisans and attract customers who are interested in supporting local businesses.

Tie-up with charities: Organize a tie-drive where customers can donate gently used ties to local charities. This can help to create a positive impact in the community while also promoting your store as a socially responsible business.

Tie-in with fashion trends: Stay up-to-date with the latest fashion trends and incorporate them into your tie selection. This can help to attract customers who are looking for stylish and on-trend accessories.

Tie-breaking tournaments: Host tie-breaking tournaments where customers can compete to see who can tie a tie the fastest and most stylishly. This can be a fun and engaging way to attract customers and promote your store as a destination for tie enthusiasts.
